Title: Fish: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis: A vulnerability was discovered in Fish when handling git repository configuration that may lead to execution of arbitrary code

Background.Text: Smart and user-friendly command line shell for macOS, Linux, and the rest of the family. It includes features like syntax highlighting, autosuggest-as-you-type, and fancy tab completions that just work, with no configuration required.

Description.Text: A vulnerability have been discovered in Fish. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: A user may be enticed to cd into a git repository under control by an attacker (e.g. on a shared filesystem or by unpacking an archive) and execute arbitrary commands.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All fish users should upgrade to the latest version:
